content.description: Start on the north side of Hadron Tower where the tower is split in two.  Climb the chimney clipping three bolts (you're welcome), then start placing gear as you turn the roof and enter the hand crack. Thoughtful climbing in an almost always shady location.
content.protection: Quick draws, runners, BD #1 and #4 gets you to chains.

climbs.name: Jungle Fever
climbs.fa: Kezzie Shuster, R. Suggett, and Cristina Marcalow

content.description: On good rock, use the small edges to power through a series of interesting moves.  Find a pocket for your first gear placement and pull to a ledge where a fun lie-back on a thin flake takes you to the anchor.
content.protection: Quick draws, BD .5, .75, and a #1 gets you to chains.
content.location: This line shares the same anchor with Guinea Worm and is right below said climb.  Use fixed lines to reach the base.

climbs.name: In Search of Quarks
climbs.fa: R. Suggett, P. Suggett, et al.

content.description: On the west side split of Hadron Tower and in the shade, climb past four bolts on good rock with fun movement.
content.protection: Four QDs and something for the chains.
content.location: Follow fixed lines to the dark corridor separating Hadron Tower from the main wall.  Climb the north face of the west side slit of Hadron Tower.

content.description: This line was Cristina's first ground up venture (with a big drill) and she showed her metal.  You move up an easy arete passing two bolts then placing gear before swinging over to the flake, and then to the anchor stance.
content.protection: Quick draws, a BD .5, and .75 gets you to chains.
content.location: After carefully working your way through the talus (the crux of this climb) you down climb through the 20 ft. chimney (easy) using the fixed line.  Walk 30 ft. through the floor of the  chimney and the climb is on openings left shoulder.

content.description: Fun arete climbing for the 5.7 climbers, et. al.  The dark patina forms good rock and blocky edges.
content.protection: Two QDs, two runners, and something for the chains.
content.location: On the west face of Hadron Tower.  Climb the arete clipping four bolts.  The first two are on the left side of the arete and the last two are on the right and are the top two bolts of In Search of Quarks.

content.description: The crux to all these lines down here is the talus approach.  Once here, the climbing is good.  This line has some thoughtful movement and is often shaded by Hedron Tower immediately behind it. Too bad the upper section did not reach closer to the top of the wall, the otherwise good looking climbing was on hollow rock.
content.location: Just left of the last of the via ferrata and the fixed line that leads you to this narrow corridor.  On the main wall opposite of In Search of Quarks.
